be.ac.ulb.crashcoin.common

Class BlockChain

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Block>
          • be.ac.ulb.crashcoin.common.BlockChain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JSONable, Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Block>, Collection<Block>, List<Block>, RandomAccess

    public class BlockChain
extends ArrayList<Block>
implements JSONable
    Represents the CrashCoin BlockChain as a list of Block instances. Manage the BlockChain. Initialises it and valids mined blocks. The add method has been overridden to verify the block to add and each of its transactions. (Note that: In CrashCoin, there is a central trusted node)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • BlockChain

        public BlockChain()
        Creates a BlockChain which contains only the genesis block. The genesis block is created through the createGenesisBlock() method.
        See Also:
        createGenesisBlock()

      • BlockChain

        public BlockChain(org.json.JSONObject json)
        Creates a BlockChain instance from its JSON representation. Used by the Master to send the BlockChain the relays.
        Parameters:
        json - the JSON representation of the BlockChain, compatible with the result of BlockChain.toJSON()
        See Also:
        toJSON()

        Verifies the block, add it to the end of the blockChain if it is valid and update the set of transactions available as inputs.

      • getLastBlock

        public Block getLastBlock()

      • getFirstBadTransaction

        protected Transaction getFirstBadTransaction(Block block)
        Gets the first bad transaction that it finds in a block, otherwise returns null. A transaction is considered bad if isValidTransaction(transaction) returns false.
        Parameters:
        block - Block that needs to be added to the blockchain
        Returns:
        First bad transaction found if there is one, null otherwise

      • isValidNextBlock

        protected boolean isValidNextBlock(Block block,
                                   int difficulty)
        Performs checks one the given block and returns whether it may be appended to the Blockchain. - The proof of work realised must correspond to the difficulty indicated in the block - The difficulty indicated must correspond to the required difficulty - The block must indicate the current last block as previous block
        Parameters:
        block - The block to check
        difficulty - the difficulty required
        Returns:
        wether the block may validly appended to the blockchain.
